00027 OgreSegment.h  -  3D Line Segment class for intersection testing in Ogre3D
00028 Some algorithms based off code from the Wild Magic library by Dave Eberly
00029 -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00030 begin                : Mon Apr 02 2007
00031 author               : Eric Cha
00032 email                : ericc@xenopi.com
00033 Code Style Update    : Apr 5, 2007
00034 -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00035 */
00036 
00037 #ifndef SEGMENT_H
00038 #define SEGMENT_H
00039 
00040 #include "OgreVector3.h"
00041 
00042 namespace Ogre
00043 {
00044     class Capsule;
00045 
00046     class Segment
00047     {
00048     public:
00049         // The segment is represented as P+t*D, where P is the segment origin,
00050         // D is a unit-length direction vector and |t| <= e.  The value e is
00051         // referred to as the extent of the segment.  The end points of the
00052         // segment are P-e*D and P+e*D.  The user must ensure that the direction
00053         // vector is unit-length.  The representation for a segment is analogous
00054         // to that for an oriented bounding box.  P is the center, D is the
00055         // axis direction, and e is the extent.
00056 
00057 
00058         // construction
00059         Segment ();  // uninitialized
00060         Segment (const Vector3&, const Vector3&, Real);
00061 
00062         // set values
00063         void set(const Vector3& newOrigin, const Vector3& newEnd);
00064         void setOrigin(const Vector3& newOrigin);
00065         void setEndPoint(const Vector3& newEndpoint);
00066 
00067         // functions to calculate distance to another segment
00068         Real distance(const Segment& otherSegment) const;
00069         Real squaredDistance(const Segment& otherSegment) const;
00070 
00071         // intersect check between segment & capsule 
00072         bool intersects(const Capsule&) const;
00073 
00074         // defining variables
00075         Vector3 mOrigin;
00076         Vector3 mDirection;
00077         Real    mExtent;
00078     };
00079 }
00080 
00081 #endif //SEGMENT_H
